page.title: 01Elburton & Brixton Villages
page.content: The block covers part of the suburban and rural areas on the east side of Plymouth and in particular encompasses the two villages of Elburton and Brixton. Elburton is part of the parish of Plymstock and is just within the Plymouth city boundary. Much of the farmland which once surrounded Elburton village is now covered by the housing estates of such developers as Wimpey, Fletcher and Brosley. However the established horticultural glass industry still survives as does the large working quarry at Billacombe. In contrast the South Hams parish of Brixton has retained its rural character with its several dairy and mixed farms. Some private house building has taken place and there is some current building but so far, ribbon development between the two villages has not yet occured.
